sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"坏的"之意。
means: bad ： 含义广泛，指任何不好的或不合需要的品质。
evil ： 语气比bad强，强调道德上的邪恶不良，含狡猾凶险或危害他人的意味。
ill与evil意义接近，但语气弱一些，常指道德或性质方面的不良。
poor ： 普通用词，侧重指事物的质量或数量低于标准或不合要求。用于指天气与食品时可与bad通用。
wicked ： 语气比evil强，指居心叵测，任意违反道德标准，有意作恶。

sentence.Network_en: Conditions for the poor in Los Angeles have not improved.
sentence.Network_cn: 洛杉矶穷人的境况仍未得到改善。

sentence.Network_en: This courtroom battle has been a poor advert for English justice.
sentence.Network_cn: 这场法庭上的争论为英格兰的司法制度做了一次拙劣的广告。

sentence.Network_en: The expedition was wrecked by bad planning and poor navigation.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次探险因计划不周和导航不利而失败。

phrase.cizu_name: (as) poor as a church mouse (或 as church mice)

jx.jx_en_mean: a wealthy young person whose money brings them no contentment (often used as an expression of mock sympathy)
jx.jx_cn_mean: [常用来表示含嘲弄语气的同情]可怜的小富哥（或妹）

jx.jx_en_mean: an inferior or cheaper substitute for the thing specified
jx.jx_cn_mean: 较劣质的（或较便宜的）替代品

lj.lj_ly: corduroy has always been the poor man's velvet.
lj.lj_ls: 灯芯绒一直是天鹅绒的便宜替代品。

jx.jx_en_mean: a person or thing that is considered inferior or subordinate to others of the same type or group
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无名小卒，微不足道的人（或东西）

lj.lj_ly: for many years radio has been the poor relation of the media.
lj.lj_ls: 多年来收音机一直是媒体中微不足道的一种形式。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French poure, from Latin pauper

entry.def: Someone who is poor has very little money and few possessions.

example.ex: The reason our schools cannot afford better teachers is because people here are poor...
example.tran: 我们的学校请不起好老师的原因是因为这里的人穷。

example.ex: He was one of thirteen children from a poor family.
example.tran: 他是13名来自贫困家庭的孩子之一。

entry.def: The people in a poor country or area have very little money and few possessions.

example.ex: Many countries in the Third World are as poor as they have ever been.
example.tran: 很多第三世界国家仍和过去一样穷困。

example.ex: ...a settlement house for children in a poor neighborhood.
example.tran: 为贫民区儿童设立的街坊文教馆

entry.def: You use poor to express your sympathy for someone.

example.ex: I feel sorry for that poor child...
example.tran: 我为那个可怜的孩子感到难过。

example.ex: Poor chap — he was killed in an air crash...
example.tran: 不幸的家伙，他死于空难。

entry.def: If you describe something as poor, you mean that it is of a low quality or standard or that it is in bad condition.

example.ex: The flat was in a poor state of repair...
The gap between the best and poorest childcare provision in the European Union has widened...
example.tran: 欧盟最好和最差的儿童保育服务之间的差距扩大了。

entry.tran: （数量、比率等）不理想的，不合理的
entry.def: If you describe an amount, rate, or number as poor, you mean that it is less than expected or less than is considered reasonable.

example.tran: 低薪和恶劣的工作条件

entry.def: You use poor to describe someone who is not very skilful in a particular activity.

example.ex: Hospitals are poor at collecting information.
example.tran: 医院收集信息能力很差。

entry.def: If something is poor in a particular quality or substance, it contains very little of the quality or substance.

example.ex: Fats and sugar are very rich in energy but poor in vitamins, minerals and dietary fibre.
example.tran: 脂肪和糖类热量很高，但维生素、矿物质和膳食纤维贫乏。

sentences.sentence: "they improved the quality from mediocre to above average"
"the shabby room struck her as extraordinarily pathetic"- Galsworthy

means.word_mean: 3. having little money or few possessions;

sentences.sentence: "deplored the gap between rich and poor countries"
"the proverbial poor artist living in a garret"

means.word_mean: 4. characterized by or indicating lack of money;
6. badly supplied with desirable qualities or substances;

sentences.sentence: "the area was poor in timber and coal"

means.word_mean: 7. not sufficient to meet a need;

Sentence.sentence: Half a century later GM is a typical example of poor management.
In March, General Motors' chief executive was fired by Mr Obama for poor management
As a result of the committee's conclusion, the branch manager Mr David Roasi reported that he had talked with McLaughlin about his extremely poor driving record.

means.word_mean: 贫困的, 贫穷的, 贫寒, 清贫

sentences.en: Many poor people gathered at the gate.
sentences.cn: 许多穷苦人聚集在门口。

sentences.en: The village used to be poor.
She is too poor to satisfy her family's material needs.
sentences.cn: 她太穷了, 无法满足家人的物质需要。

means.word_mean: 贫乏的; 缺乏; 缺少

sentences.en: The farm is a very poor one.

means.word_mean: 低劣的; 次等的; 劣质的; 差的; 次的

sentences.en: An actor who mouths his lines is a poor actor.
sentences.cn: 装腔作势背台词的演员不是好演员。

sentences.en: My handwriting is poorer than hers.
He's still in poor health after his illness.
sentences.cn: 病好后他的身体仍很弱。

means.word_mean: 可怜的; 不幸的; 令人同情的

sentences.en: The poor old man had lost both his sons in the war.
sentences.cn: 这位不幸的老人在战争中失去了两个儿子。

jushi.english: It is one of the poorest countries in the world.
jushi.chinese: 这是世界上最贫穷的国家之一。

jushi.english: The poor man always wants to have a really comfortable home.
jushi.chinese: 这个可怜的男人一直想拥有一个真正舒适的家。

jushi.english: A poor man came to the house this morning, begging for food.
jushi.chinese: 今天上午有个穷人到这户人家来讨东西吃。
